00022 #warning "Since Dec 2013 (when support for UDP/Unicast and TCP was added to \
00023           NetUtilities and the UDP/Multicast code was moved there with it) \
00024           the multicast.h header is no longer supported."
00025 
00026 #ifndef __MULTICAST_H__
00027 #include <stdlib.h>      // needed for malloc(..) and free(..)
00028 #include <string.h>      // needed for strcmp(..) and memset(..)
00029 #include <unistd.h>
00030 #include <math.h>        // needed for floorf
00031 #include <netinet/in.h>
00032 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00033 #include <sys/select.h>
00034 #include <sys/ioctl.h>  // needed to find network interface
00035 #include <sys/types.h>  // needed for select
00036 #include <sys/time.h>   // needed for select
00037 #include <net/if.h>     // see "man 7 netdevice"
00038 
00039 // The "struct ip_mreqn" was added to Linux 2.2 and is simply a copy of "struct ip_mreq"
00040 // with an additional "imr_ifindex" field added to the end, it is not present under
00041 // OS X, so we simply bypass the use of "imr_ifindex". It is likely "struct ip_mreqn"
00042 // is missing under BSD too, but this is untested.
00043 #if (defined(__APPLE__) && defined(__MACH__))
00044 # define using_ip_mreq_for_ip_mreqn 1
00045 # define ip_mreqn    ip_mreq
00046 # define imr_address imr_multiaddr
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 #ifndef DEFAULT_SO_RCVBUF
00050 /* Default SO_RCVBUF size in bytes. Older versions of this include file
00051  used 128 MiB which was a fairly poor choice for all but the highest
00052  data rates.
00053  */
00054 # define DEFAULT_SO_RCVBUF 2097152 // 2MiB
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifndef DEFAULT_SO_SNDBUF
00058 /* Default SO_SNDBUF size in bytes. */
00059 # define DEFAULT_SO_SNDBUF -1
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 #define MCAST_ADDRESS_MASK 0x000000E0
00063 
00065 typedef struct multicast_tag {
00067   int sock;
00068 
00070   struct sockaddr_in addr;
00071 
00072   char is_mcast;
00073 } multicast_t;
00074 
00078 static inline void multicast_close(multicast_t &mcast) {
00079   if (mcast.sock > 0) {
00080     close(mcast.sock);
00081     mcast.sock = -1;
00082   }
00083 }
00084 
00089 static inline bool multicast_is_open(const multicast_t &mcast) {
00090   return (mcast.sock > 0);
00091 }
00092 
00097 static inline multicast_t multicast_none() {
00098   multicast_t multicast;
00099   multicast.sock = -1;
00100   return multicast;
00101 }
00102 
00110 static multicast_t multicast_open_(const char* iface, const char* group,
00111     int port, bool is_receiver) {
00112   size_t ii;
00113   int one = 1;
00114 
00115   multicast_t multicast = { socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP) };
00116   if (multicast.sock < 0)
00117     return multicast;
00118   setsockopt(multicast.sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &one, sizeof(one));
00119 
00120   in_addr ip_addr;
00121   if (strcmp(group,"") != 0) {
00122     if (inet_aton(group, &ip_addr) == 0) {
00123       close(multicast.sock);
00124       multicast.sock = -1;
00125       return multicast;
00126     }
00127     multicast.is_mcast = ((((int32_t) ip_addr.s_addr) & MCAST_ADDRESS_MASK)
00128         == MCAST_ADDRESS_MASK);
00129   }
00130   else {
00131     // Assume unicast receive
00132     multicast.is_mcast = false;
00133   }
00134 
00135   // Enumerate all the devices
00136   struct ifconf devs = { 0 };
00137   devs.ifc_len = 512 * sizeof(struct ifreq);
00138   devs.ifc_buf = (char*) malloc(devs.ifc_len);
00139   if (devs.ifc_buf == 0) {
00140     close(multicast.sock);
00141     multicast.sock = -1;
00142     return multicast;
00143   }
00144   if (ioctl(multicast.sock, SIOCGIFCONF, &devs) < 0) {
00145     close(multicast.sock);
00146     multicast.sock = -1;
00147     free(devs.ifc_buf);
00148     return multicast;
00149   }
00150   for (ii = 0; ii < devs.ifc_len / sizeof(struct ifreq); ii++) {
00151     // The next line does not work on OS X / GCC 4.2.1 as it does not have the
00152     // union for ifr_ifrn (possibly affects BSD too). However as "ifr_name" is
00153     // usually defined as a pre-processor replacement for "ifr_ifrn.ifrn_name"
00154     // on Linux, the line below it should work.
00155     //if (strcmp(iface, devs.ifc_req[ii].ifr_ifrn.ifrn_name) == 0) {
00156     if (strcmp(iface, devs.ifc_req[ii].ifr_name) == 0) {
00157       struct ip_mreqn mreqn;
00158       struct ifreq dev = devs.ifc_req[ii];
00159       if (ioctl(multicast.sock, SIOCGIFFLAGS, &dev) < 0) {
00160         close(multicast.sock);
00161         multicast.sock = -1;
00162         free(devs.ifc_buf);
00163         return multicast;
00164       }
00165       if (!(dev.ifr_flags & IFF_UP) || (dev.ifr_flags & IFF_LOOPBACK)
00166           || !(multicast.is_mcast || (dev.ifr_flags & IFF_MULTICAST))) {
00167         close(multicast.sock);
00168         multicast.sock = -1;
00169         free(devs.ifc_buf);
00170         return multicast;
00171       }
00172 
00173       // OS X does not support SIOCGIFINDEX (see "man 7 netdevice" on Linux), rather
00174       // it provides if_nametoindex(..) (see "man 3 if_nametoindex" on OS X). Although
00175       // if_nametoindex(..) is available on a number of Linux distributions, it is not
00176       // used here due to performance issues (at one point if_nametoindex(..) had very
00177       // high overhead on Linux/BSD) and possible compatibility issues (read this last
00178       // reason as "don't break what we know has worked for years"). It also appears
00179       // that SIOCGIFINDEX isn't available on some some versions of BSD, so hopefully
00180       // this will work there too.
00181 #ifdef SIOCGIFINDEX
00182       if (ioctl(multicast.sock, SIOCGIFINDEX, &dev) != 0) {
00183         close(multicast.sock);
00184         multicast.sock = -1;
00185         free(devs.ifc_buf);
00186         return multicast;
00187       }
00188 #endif
00189 
00190       if (multicast.is_mcast) {
00191         memset(&mreqn, 0, sizeof(mreqn));
00192         mreqn.imr_multiaddr = ip_addr;
00193         mreqn.imr_address = ((struct sockaddr_in*) (&dev.ifr_addr))->sin_addr;
00194 #if defined(SIOCGIFINDEX) && !defined(using_ip_mreq_for_ip_mreqn)
00195         mreqn.imr_ifindex = dev.ifr_ifindex;
00196 #endif
00197         if (setsockopt(multicast.sock, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_IF, &mreqn, sizeof(struct ip_mreqn)) != 0) {
00198           close(multicast.sock);
00199           multicast.sock = -1;
00200           free(devs.ifc_buf);
00201           return multicast;
00202         }
00203         multicast.addr.sin_addr.s_addr = mreqn.imr_multiaddr.s_addr;
00204       } else {
00205         multicast.addr.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00206       }
00207       multicast.addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00208       multicast.addr.sin_port = htons(port);
00209       if (is_receiver) {
00210         if (bind(multicast.sock, (struct sockaddr*) &multicast.addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) != 0) {
00211           close(multicast.sock);
00212           multicast.sock = -1;
00213           free(devs.ifc_buf);
00214           return multicast;
00215         }
00216         if (multicast.is_mcast) {
00217           // only bind if we are server
00218           if (setsockopt(multicast.sock, IPPROTO_IP, IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP, &mreqn,
00219               sizeof(struct ip_mreqn)) != 0) {
00220             close(multicast.sock);
00221             multicast.sock = -1;
00222             free(devs.ifc_buf);
00223             return multicast;
00224           }
00225         }
00226       } else {
00227         multicast.addr.sin_addr = ip_addr;
00228       }
00229       free(devs.ifc_buf);
00230       return multicast;
00231     }
00232   }
00233   // If we get here, we've failed
00234   close(multicast.sock);
00235   free(devs.ifc_buf);
00236   multicast.sock = -1;
00237   return multicast;
00238 }
00239 
00248 static inline multicast_t multicast_client(const char* iface,
00249     const char* group, int port, int size = DEFAULT_SO_RCVBUF) {
00250   multicast_t client = multicast_open_(iface, group, port, true);
00251   if (client.sock != -1) {
00252     if (!client.is_mcast && strcmp(group, "") != 0) {
00253       // If we get here, we've failed
00254       close(client.sock);
00255       client.sock = -1;
00256       return client;
00257     }
00258     if (size >= 0) {
00259       if (setsockopt(client.sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &size, sizeof(int))
00260           != 0) {
00261         close(client.sock);
00262         client.sock = -1;
00263       }
00264     }
00265   }
00266   return client;
00267 }
00268 
00278 static inline ssize_t multicast_receive(multicast_t &client, void* buffer,
00279     size_t bytes, float timeout_in_seconds) {
00280   if (timeout_in_seconds >= 0) {
00281     int srv = 0;
00282     struct timeval tv;
00283     tv.tv_sec = (long) floorf(timeout_in_seconds);
00284     float tmp = timeout_in_seconds - tv.tv_sec;
00285     tv.tv_usec = (long) floorf(tmp * 1e6);
00286     fd_set readset;
00287     FD_ZERO(&readset);
00288     FD_SET(client.sock, &readset);
00289     int maxfd = client.sock + 1;
00290     srv = select(maxfd, &readset, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00291     if (srv <= 0)
00292       return 0;
00293   }
00294   return recv(client.sock, buffer, bytes, 0);
00295 }
00296 
00306 static inline multicast_t multicast_server(const char* iface,
00307     const char* group, int port, uint8_t ttl, int size = DEFAULT_SO_SNDBUF) {
00308   if (strcmp(group,"")==0){
00309     return multicast_none();
00310   }
00311   multicast_t server = multicast_open_(iface, group, port, false);
00312   if (server.sock != -1) {
00313     if (server.is_mcast) {
00314       setsockopt(server.sock, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_TTL, &ttl, sizeof(ttl));
00315     }
00316     if (size >= 0) {
00317       if (setsockopt(server.sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, &size, sizeof(int))
00318           != 0) {
00319         close(server.sock);
00320         server.sock = -1;
00321       }
00322     }
00323   }
00324   return server;
00325 }
00326 
00333 static inline ssize_t multicast_transmit(multicast_t &server,
00334     const void* buffer, size_t bytes) {
00335 
00336   ssize_t sent = sendto(server.sock, buffer, bytes, 0, (struct sockaddr*) &server.addr,
00337       sizeof(server.addr));
00338 //  an exception probably should be thrown here
00339 //  if (sent < 0) {
00340 //    throw VRTException("Could not send data to host=%s port=%d device=%s", host.c_str(), port, device.c_str());
00341 //  }
00342   return sent;
00343 }
